SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_RUN_232_CUT_000_060.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_RUN_232_CUT_000_060.text:
The Soyays helped me find it.
Pretty great, huh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_RUN_232_CUT_000_070.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_RUN_232_CUT_000_070.text:
Thank you, Sis.
I'll always treasure it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_000.text:
At last you have come, Chup,
Maiden of the Epuyke. This season's Epuyke blossomed full and
beautiful. It absorbed the dreams of the
evil god Ancikar who slumbers underground,
then brilliantly returned to the earth.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_020.text:
I know. And if I'm going to bloom,
I'm going to be stunning—but I won't
be doing it for you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_030.text:
So what was the name of
this season's Epuyke maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_040.text:
The present Epuyke was once
an individual named Wakka.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_050.text:
So if I become the Epuyke, am I going
to be 'an individual once named Chup'?
Ugh. Can't say I feel good about that. Here's the deal: when I make the most
beautiful blossoms—and I am TOTALLY going
to make the most beautiful blossoms—
I want you to say 'Wooo! Chup rules!'

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_200_CUT_000_070.text:
Not NOW, you dingbat!
...But yeah, just like that.

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_200_CUT_000_010.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_200_CUT_000_010.text:
You make it sound like
it grew all on its own...

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_210_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_210_CUT_000_020.text:
This was fun when I was a kid, but now
I realize I didn't get it at ALL.

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_210_CUT_000_030.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_210_CUT_000_030.text:
I think that's pretty normal; I've been
to loads of festivals over the years,
but I never had a clue what most
of them were actually all about.

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_020.text:
Boy, they're really going nuts...
I wonder if my pollen will taste
that good.

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_030.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_030.text:
Can't say I'm much of a pollen girl,
but I'm sure you'll do great.

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_040.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_220_CUT_000_040.text: Fair enough. Now let's get going.

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_230_CUT_000_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_230_CUT_000_030.text:
If you eat the pollen,
you turn into a Kikir.

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_230_CUT_000_040.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_230_CUT_000_040.text:
I was only kidding; you'll never find me
stuffing a bunch of pollen down my gullet.

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_230_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_230_CUT_000_050.text:
It's really hard to tell when
you're joking sometimes...

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_240_CUT_000_020.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_240_CUT_000_020.text:
I'm in the middle of my
trial thingies.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_210_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_210_CUT_000_050.text:
I'll do what I can, okay?
That's all I can really promise.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Maiden Chup!
Hail, Soyays the Pollinators!
The time for the ritual has come.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_050.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_050.text:
Say, what are your names, anyway?
You've never told me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_070.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_000_070.text:
Bwaaaaaa ha ha ha ha!
Oh man, those names are HILARIOUS! Er, but thanks for everything.
Seriously.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_000_080.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_000_080.text:
No! Ancikar has possessed
the maiden's body!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_000.text:
As we suspected, maidens who run from their
trials are tainted; I fear Ancikar has crept into
the crevices of her heart.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_020.text:
We must cut down that wicked blossom.
If we do not, Ancikar's power will spread
out across the land.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_030.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_030.text: Stop! Don't cut down my sister!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_040.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_040.text:
This is just another trial.
The god of the Imeru is testing us—
and we can't have you interfering!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_050.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_050.text:
Keep calling out to Chup, Kup!
We'll save her! We promise!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_070.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_070.text:
The two of us are Chup's Soyays, and
we need to guide her to the bitter end.
We won't let her journey end like this!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_090.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_010_090.text: I hear you, Sis! It's me! Kup!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_020_000.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_020_000.text:
Chup! You can hear Kup's voice, can't you?
You can't make her cry! You can't let yourself
be beaten by Ancikar's dreams!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_000.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_000.text: I knew this all connected to the triangle in some way; it's all our fault that Chup had to turn into that wicked blossom. I'm sorry, Chup. I'm so sorry.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_010.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_010.text:
It must've been real hard for you, darlin',
but you were an amazing sister to the last
who never made her little sis cry. So all you
need do now is blossom up real pretty.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_020.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_020.text:
Please trust in my sister.
Trust in the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_030.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_030_030.text:
We are guided by the Imeru god's will,
and so shall watch over the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_000.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_000.text:
Can you hear me, Sis?
You're SUCH a pretty flower!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_010.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_010.text:
Thank you, Kup...
I heard...your voice...

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_020.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_020.text:
I'm sorry we were such
undependable Soyays, Chup.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_021.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_021.text:
But we're both really relieved that
you were able to become the Epuyke.
You did just what you set out to.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_030.speaker: Tyupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_210_CUT_040_030.text:
Ha ha... Yeah...
Thanks, both of you...

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_000.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_000.text:
It feels like that whole journey was over
in an instant. Still, what do you think
Chup's flowers are going to be like?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_001.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_001.text:
Heck, darlin', they're gonna knock
everybody's boots clean off!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_020.text:
You have borne witness to the Imeru's Epuyke
festival as the 80,136th Soyays the Pollinators.
I now pronounce you freed from your duty.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_030.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_030.text:
Should we stay here until Chup...
I mean, until the Epuyke blooms?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_040.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_040.text:
Half the Soyays remain to watch the Epuyke
bloom, while the other half run away as if
for their very lives. It is your choice which
manner of Soyays you wish to be.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_050.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_050.text:
Well, we still need to say 'Chup rules,'
so I think we should stay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_051.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_051.text:
Yessir, that girl was real guarded when
it came to her feelings, but I still reckon
she'd want us to stay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_060.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_060.text:
And yet, you are now merely two women.
We cannot stand here speaking to you,
for we must be off to greet the
80,137th Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_100.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_010_100.text:
Epuyke nogonoa kowo to you,
the 80,136th Soyays the Pollinators!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_020_000.speaker: Kupu
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_200_CUT_020_000.text:
Can you hear me, Sis?
You're SUCH a pretty flower now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_END_POLLEN_200_CUT_000.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_END_POLLEN_200_CUT_000.text:
Reckon this means she wants to ride along
on our journey. I think we oughta take it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_060.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_060.text:
What you just said there didn't
make a lick of sense. What kind
of world is this, anyway?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_080.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_080.text:
It's clear they're not interested
in listening to us.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_090.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_090.text:
By the power of the god of we Imeru,
we have summoned you, the 1,080,362nd
Soyays the Pollinators, to guide the
Epuyke's maiden.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_100.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_100.text:
I suppose all this stuff about Epuykes and
Soyays may have something to do with the
triangle we're looking for, but I still have no
idea what we're supposed to do.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_130.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_130.text:
If this is so important, why don't
you folks do it yourselves?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_140.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_140.text:
All is as the god of the Imeru wills it.
This is part of the original promise made
between the god of the Imeru and Ancikar—
the evil which slumbers in the earth. Alas, this season's maiden is quite the handful,
which is why I believe you have been summoned.
For of all possible Soyays in all the worlds,
you two are best suited for this task.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_141.speaker: Bonnie_Blair

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_150.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_150.text:
Let's just go with the interpretation that
they've got high hopes for us—and that
we'll find a triangle if we live up to them.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_160.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_AREAIN_300_CUT_000_160.text:
Now go forth and guide the maiden.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Welcome to Berta Village,
Soyays the Pollinators.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_010.text:
Hello. We're Formina and Bonnie, and we've
been chosen to be Soyays—even if we don't
really know what that involves, exactly.
Still, it's nice to meet you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_020.text:
Your greeting is recognized and appreciated.
I am called Yuk, and my daughter, Nana,
is who you will be guiding on her quest
to become a wonderful Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_030.text:
Sorry! Sorry. Know I'm late—had to change,
what with me being the maiden and all.
Never really worn anything like this
before, but whatcha gonna do, am I right?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_040.text:
This here's your daughter? Heck, darlin',
you two couldn't look more different!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_050.text:
Yes, I suppose I can
understand your surprise.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_060.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_060.text:
Though our appearances differ, I raised Nana
as my daughter. Even our god can see she is
a proud Imeru on the inside, for this is why
she was granted the markings.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_070.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_070.text:
You mean the pattern on her face?
I assumed she painted that herself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_080.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_080.text:
Nope! I just woke up one morning
and BAM! Face markings. The village freaked out, because they couldn't
believe 'that Nana'—which is how they say my name,
by the way, super judgy—they couldn't believe
'that Nana' had been chosen to be the maiden. You should have seen their faces. Seriously,
like, EVERY jaw was dragging across the ground
and their eyes were all bugging out. It made
all this maiden business completely worth it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_090.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_090.text:
The god of the Imeru has chosen my daughter,
and though I know she will bloom into a most
beautiful Epuyke, I still remain uneasy.
So please, Soyays—guide her well.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_100.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_100.text: Er, and what does guiding her involve?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_110.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_110.text:
Okay, so basically I have to go pass three
trials: strength, wisdom, and love. As my Soyays,
you and me have to work together to overcome
them before the next Epuyke withers.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_130.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_130.text:
It's a big... Well, it's this... Look, it's gonna
be way easier to just show you, okay?
The Epuyke is gonna bloom while we're working
on the trials, so you can see it then. Cool?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_140.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_140.text:
Yeah, I suppose it's best to just focus
on completing the trials for now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_150.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_150.text:
Exactly! Now let's get moving—
we don't actually have that much time.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_160.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_160.text:
Please take care of my Nana,
Soyays the Pollinators.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_200.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_200.text:
Okay, so let me introduce myself again:
I'm Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke. And this part I didn't want to say in front
of Mom, but I wasn't born in this world.
I mean, obviously, but figured I should just
get it all out there anyway, you know? Yeah, so I came here with another Soyay,
but when they left me behind, Mom decided
to raise me as her own. That's the story.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_210.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_210.text:
Anyway, apparently the Soyay who brought me
here wore these clothes, and for some reason
Mom insisted I wear them on my trials.
So that's why I'm dressed like this. Oh hey! Once the Epuyke ritual is over,
do you think I'll go back to the world
that Soyay came from?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_220.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_220.text: Is that what you want to do?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_230.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_230.text:
I dunno. I mean, I'd LOVE to get out there
and visit strange worlds, you know?
But I'm also from here, so I can't
imagine living out there forever.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_240.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_240.text:
Anyway, now you know the whole story.
So be my guides, Soyays, and be good ones.
Let's go do this thing! Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_250.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_250.text:
Reckon this is what those folks meant
when they said this one was a handful.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_260.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_260.text:
I'm not certain they should be talking
about her like that, considering she was
apparently chosen by their god and all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_270.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_300_CUT_000_270.text:
Could be, but probably best we keep our nose
outta that sort of business. We gotta find
the triangle, which means we should just
focus on bein' the best Soyays we can be.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Nana, maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyays the Pollinators!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Wisdom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_010.text:
Do you know what this
trial entails, Nana?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_020.text:
The Trial of Wisdom is a test of one's wisdom,
knowledge, and discretion, and is undertaken
to determine whether or not a maiden is suited
to become the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_030.text:
I am pleased to see you were not raised by
Yuk with nothing to show for it. That said,
the Trial of Wisdom also reaffirms your
connection with the land.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_040.text:
So I'll be looking back on the
time I've spent here?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_050.text:
If I may speak plainly, we are all
rather perplexed as to why the god
of the Imeru has chosen you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_060.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_060.text:
Okay, seriously? I've got TONS of memories
with the land, which the god of the Imeru
would totally know. I am an Imeru, just like
everyone else. It isn't that hard.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_070.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_070.text:
This is true—and yet, we cannot help but
look at the differences which separate you
from the rest of our kind. Perhaps this is a revelation from the god of
the Imeru asking us to be more considerate of
what lies inside? Regardless, I pray you might 
overcome the Trial of Wisdom.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_090.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_090.text:
She must collect fragments of the Epuyke Tablet
which have been scattered across the land,
put them back together, and decipher the tale
written upon it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_120.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_120.text:
Oh, I'm going to decipher it, all right—
and when I do, you'll see that my heart
is no different from yours!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_130.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_130.text:
You're not going to give us any hints about
where we could find them or how many there
are? Or is that all just also part of the trial?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_140.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_300_CUT_000_140.text:
You have seen the truth of it, Soyay.
Now go find the fragments and return to me.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Look! A fragment of the Epuyke Tablet!
Oh, and there's a pattern carved on it!
Am I supposed to decipher this? Really?
Because I have ZERO idea what I'm looking at.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_300_CUT_000_010.text:
So who wrote these things
in the first place?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_300_CUT_000_020.text:
Yeah, so I've heard the tablet is actually
born at the same time the maiden appears?
It grows up from the ground just like this. Some people say the dreams of the Ancikar are
carved into it, but other people say it actually
contains a divine message from the Imeru god.
Truth is, nobody knows for sure.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_300_CUT_000_030.text:
Oh, and I was also told the fragments would
appear in places that are important to me,
but I've never even BEEN to this place before,
so that's just weird.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_010.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_010.text:
These fragments are a lot bigger
than I was expecting.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_020.text:
Mom used to bring me here sometimes—she'd
stare at the Epuyke and then cry all quietly.
I'd always pretend not to notice, because I
just had a feeling I wasn't supposed to ask.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_030.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_030.text:
We heard the Epuyke gives life to this world,
so it wouldn't be surprising for your mother
to have some memories of it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_040.text:
Yeah, maybe. You know, I thought a lot about
the maidens and how they must've felt when they
became the Epuyke. Were they embarrassed to have
everyone staring at them? Or were they proud?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_050.text: Still, even with all that thinking, I never imagined I'd be chosen to be the maiden. Always figured it'd be someone else's problem.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_310_CUT_000_070.text:
I dunno. I just wonder if Mom's gonna look
at me and cry once I turn into the Epuyke.
That's all I can think about right now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_020.text:
Oh wow, this is the same as our birth-seed husks!
See, whenever an Imeru is born, the parents save
the husk and turn it into some kind of accessory
the kids can wear around.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_030.text:
But I never got an accessory—and when I asked Mom
why, she didn't know how to answer. Of course,
now I know it's because I wasn't born from a seed,
but at the time it made zero sense.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_040.text:
Anyway, one day she brought out this super old
husk from the storehouse and said it was mine,
but I knew that wasn't true. So I burst out
crying and she just kind of...stood there.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_050.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_050.text:
That's the sweetest dang thing I ever heard.
Your ma sounds like a real peach.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_060.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_060.text:
Later, I went to the storehouse and found
the box where the husk was stored. The name
'Nuy' was written on it, but I've never
gotten up the guts to ask Mom who that is.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_070.text:
...Wow. I've never told anyone that
story before. I suppose this means
I really trust you, huh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_080.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_080.text:
It feels nice to share secrets with someone.
I just wish there was time for the three of us
to sit down for some tea and gab the day away.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_090.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_090.text:
Heck, that's a great idea! I still ain't heard
about that main squeeze of yours, Formina—
plus I wanna know about Nana's old flames!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_100.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_320_CUT_000_100.text:
Old...flames? Do people keep fire
for a long time in your world?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_330_CUT_000_010.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_330_CUT_000_010.text:
I really hope this tablet serves as
proof of your heart in the end.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_330_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_330_CUT_000_020.text:
Oh, I was just irritated by the stuff she
was saying—I'm a whole lot calmer now.
Honestly, whatever's written on the tablet
isn't going to surprise me. Probably.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_330_CUT_000_030.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_330_CUT_000_030.text:
Getting upset or angry isn't
anything to be ashamed of. Anyway, enough of that. It's time to
try putting these fragments together.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_330_CUT_000_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TABLET_330_CUT_000_040.text:
Well then, we'd better
get back to the witness.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_000_000.text:
Maiden Nana, you have collected
all the Epuyke Tablet fragments.
Now put them together, if you can.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_010.text:
Thus marks the end of the Trial of Wisdom.
Whether you choose to speak of the message
written on the tablet or keep it to yourself
is a decision made at your discretion.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_030.text:
Of course. It is a revelation
meant for you alone.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_040.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_040.text:
As your witness, I was unsure if the tablet
fragments would grow—or if your Soyays
would even be able to find them. But the will of the Imeru god is ever wise,
and I am relieved to see you were able to
complete the trial.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_010_050.text:
You know, people have always said terrible
things about me behind my back—called me an
animal and worse. And Mom... Well, you don't
even want to KNOW the things they said to her. But you know what? Screw 'em. I'm gonna
become the Epuyke and bless this land
no matter WHAT they all think of me!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_000.text:
Oh, who am I kidding!? I can't do this!
I'm not an Imeru, I don't have a husk—
there's no WAY I can put this together! Clearly, the god of the Imeru just gave
me these markings as a punishment.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_010.text:
There have been other maidens who have been
unable to overcome every trial, Nana—you must
not give up. All is according to the will of the
Imeru's god, after all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_020.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_020.text:
See? Even the witness thinks
you're too quick to give up.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_030.text:
Sorry. I'm sorry.
Just lost myself a bit.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_050.text: I can't do it. There's no way.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_060.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_999_060.text:
So be it, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke.
So be it, Soyays the Pollinators.
All I can do now is pray you safely
finish the ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_000.text:
Okay, so I read the tablet, and it
told me to go to the Kieru Ruins.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_010.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_010.text:
I see. You may reach the ruins by taking the
branching path managed by the Kikir in the
cavern that connects to Doroso Village.
I will notify the Kikir to expect you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_020.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_020.text: Are these ruins part of the trial?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_030.text:
No. The trial ended when the maiden finished
deciphering the tablet. Whether or not you
choose to follow the tablet's instruction
is up to the two of you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_040.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_040.text: What are the ruins like, Nana?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_050.text:
I don't know—I've never been.
The Kikir manage that area,
so the Imeru don't go there.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_080.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_080.text:
Hear me, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hear me, Soyays the Pollinators!
I pray that you might safely finish
the Epuyke ritual. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_100.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_100.text:
So what do you want to do, Nana? Should
we go to the Kieru Ruins, or do you want
to prioritize your duty as the maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_110.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_110.text:
The tablet is a revelation from the god of the
Imeru—and though I am not Imeru, I know I was
given these markings for a reason, so I feel
like I have to do as the tablet says...

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_130.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_020_130.text: So let's go find the ruins.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_030.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_030.text:
The words of the tablet may remain
forever in your heart if you wish it.
My role is to witness, not to know.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_060.speaker: Witness_of_Wisdom
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_060.text:
Hear me, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke.
Hear me, Soyays the Pollinators.
All I can do now is pray you safely
finish the Epuyke ritual.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_WISDOM_310_CUT_030_070.text:
I'll do what I can, but I just don't know
how this is going to turn out.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kikiris
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyays the Pollinators! I hear the revelation on the Epuyke Tablet
bid you come to this place. This will be an
inconvenience to the people of Doroso Village,
but they will simply have to make their peace.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Kikiris
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_300_CUT_000_010.text:
The path is connected—please go ahead.
Also, so far as I know, there is nothing
within the Kieru Ruins, but I trust it is
important to you. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_000_000.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_000_000.text:
I suppose people used to live here
at some point in the past, right?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_000_030.text: Do you mind if I walk ahead?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_000_040.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_000_040.text: Reckon we should go with her?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_000.text:
I found this on the ground—there's something
written on it that I can't read. I think it may
have belonged to a past Soyay?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_010.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_010.text:
Well, shoot! It's a notebook.
Give it here, darlin'.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_060.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_060.text:
'For reasons unclear, I have been summoned
to this world by some sort of magic. I am apparently
meant to walk with someone labeled a 'maiden'
and aid her in a series of trials.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_070.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_070.text:
But I have only a few days supply
of both diapers and milk remaining,
and I don't know what to do.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_080.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_080.text:
I was right! This WAS left
by a previous Soyay!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_090.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_090.text:
Let's see what else it says.
'May 7th...'

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_100.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_100.text:
'When I awoke, I thought for a moment this
 had all been a dream, but it was not to be.
Time is...strange here—fluid—which is why
I have decided to write all of this down.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_110.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_110.text:
The easiest way to return to my world is to 
abandon the maiden, but am torn as to whether
or not this is an ethical decision to make. I have no one else to talk to.
I don't know what to do.
I cannot leave Nana alone.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_140.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_140.text:
'I spoke to the clerics; the maiden's
mother will look after Nana while I'm off
helping her daughter on the trials. I know Nuy will not return home if I am
successful, and yet I still feel this is
something I must do.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_160.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_160.text:
So far as I can tell—although I suppose
it's possible I'm misreading parts of it.
Do you want me to stop?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_190.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_190.text:
'Today, I set out on my trials
with the maiden, Nuy. Her mother, Yuk, will be taking care of Nana
while I'm away—and even though Yuk's own
daughter is going to become the Epuyke,
all she does is fuss over me and Nana.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_200.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_200.text:
I don't know much about this world, but I do
know this: Yuk is a good person—even though
I would lose my mind if someone told me
Nana had to become this Epuyke thing.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_210.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_210.text:
When these trials are over—when we return
to our world and Nana grows up—I'll tell
her about everything that happened here. She's probably going to think I'm making
it up—or that I'm mad—and I won't be able
to blame her for either one. Perhaps I'll even write a book about
this place one day—I imagine it would
sell quite well.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_220.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_220.text:
Oh, one last thing: I learned to say 'Epuyke
nogonoa kowo' in the local dialect. People say
this to me constantly, and it roughly means,
'May the blossoms of the Epuyke watch over you.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_230.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_230.text:
Well, it's time for me to go.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo, my precious Nana.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_240.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_240.text:
*sniff* I'm sorry, Nana—I know that
was a lot. I mean, I'M tearing up
and this isn't even about me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_260.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_260.text:
Might'a been for the best if
you didn't hear that at all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_270.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_270.text:
I don't... I can't...
I don't even know what to say.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_271.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_271.text:
Still, I reckon the god of the Imeru knew
the diary was here though since it told
Nana to come all the way out here. Hard to imagine we were called to this here world
by some sorta divine being, but I don't know how
else to square it. Also makes me wonder what it's
got in store for us next.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_272.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_272.text:
This is the same god who called Nana's mother
to this world and then chose Nana to be the
current maiden. So maybe all of this—including
us—is connected and leading to something.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_280.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_280.text:
Your feeling better now, Nana?
I know that was rough.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_290.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_310_CUT_010_290.text:
Yeah, I'm better—but we're heading back 
to the village. I'm done pretending I don't
know about any of this, and it's time to
hear what Mom has to say.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_000.text:
I found this on the ground—do you know
what it is? I think it may have belonged
to a past Soyay, because it's definitely
not from this world.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_010.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_010.text:
Reckon it's some kind of machine.
You know how to work it, Formina?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_020.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_020.text:
Nope. Let's just try pushing this
and hope it doesn't explode.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_030.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_030.text:
FILE GREEN 105:
RE: THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN
ANCIKAR AND THE MAIDEN

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_040.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_040.text:
The residents claim the Epuyke flower
purifies the dreams of an evil deity
they call Ancikar. But if we assume that to be true, surely this
evil god would consider the process of a maiden
becoming the flower and absorbing its power
to be an act of aggression.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_050.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_050.text:
But no hostile relationship can last forever,
so perhaps this is better thought of as kind
of forced symbiosis where both the maiden
and Ancikar gain something.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_060.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_060.text:
FILE GREEN 080:
QUESTIONABILITY OF ANCIKAR'S EXISTENCE

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_070.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_070.text: Has any resident actually seen the evil deity Ancikar? The clerics refuse to answer when I ask to see records of its awakening—or to even confirm such records exist at all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_080.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_080.text:
Perhaps Ancikar is not a living being at all,
but instead a metaphor for natural phenomena—
one which serves much the same purpose as dragons
and demons in the myths of other worlds. If so, there would be records of eruptions,
floods, and the like—and these things would
still be happening.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_090.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_090.text:
The Imeru have a magical civilization mature
enough to summon ritual attendants from other
worlds, yet continue carrying out an arcane
practice where one of them becomes the Epuyke. It is a truly fascinating dichotomy.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_100.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_100.text:
FILE GREEN 208:
RE: THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN
ANCIKAR AND THE MAIDEN #36

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_110.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_110.text:
Let us assume for the moment the hypothesis
that the maiden does not absorb and purify
Ancikar's magic is correct. Perhaps, then, in exchange for receiving the
maiden's life force in the form of her soul,
Ancikar returns that same force to the earth
in the form of energy.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_120.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_120.text:
FILE GREEN 005:
RE: THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN
ANCIKAR AND THE MAIDEN #908

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_130.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_130.text:
What if Ancikar does not exist as an individual
being, but is instead an aggregate of all the
sacrificed maidens' souls? How much remorse
and anger would such a creature possibly hold?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_140.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_140.text:
And what if the Maiden's Garden—the place
said to be the destination for the souls
of all maidens who become the Epuyke—
is Ancikar itself?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_160.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_160.text:
I came here by chance as an inspector,
and have been attempting to examine my
hypotheses and speculations from the
viewpoint of a rational scholar. And yet, there is a mythical makeup
to this world that science, biology,
and even folklore cannot fully explain.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_170.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_170.text: An example of this is how those who ingest the Epuyke's pollen are unable to leave this world. ...But it tasted so good.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_180.speaker: YellowTribe_FellowF
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_180.text:
I believe roughly 50,000 cycles of base time have
passed since I arrived. And while many others—
called Pollinators—have been summoned here, there
have been no other inspectors from the base. This is most unfortunate. Sadly, there's little
I can do other than leave this here in the hopes
that another of my kind will eventually find
their way here and read it.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_200.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_200.text:
I don't understand any of that.
What were they trying to say?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_210.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_210.text:
It was a whole heap'a stuff about Ancikar
and maidens, but after that it lost me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_220.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_220.text:
I think it was implying that
Ancikar IS the Epuyke's maidens.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_230.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_230.text:
No. No, that's not possible. I mean,
it would be the gravest of insults to
think of the maidens as evil. I mean, sure, waking up one morning with markings
that mean you're now a maiden is probably hard to
accept for some people. But the idea it leads to
a grudge? To some kind of...eternal rage? No. Whoever wrote all of that clearly
doesn't understand the Imeru at all.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_240.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_240.text:
Stay calm, Nana; this is just one
person's opinion. You don't have
to accept it if you don't want to.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_250.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_250.text: Okay, but do YOU believe it?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_260.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_KIERU_320_CUT_010_260.text:
I couldn't begin to confirm any of that—
and even if I could, I'd still take your
word over some random person I've
never met.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_000.text:
There are so many things I want to talk
to you about, Mom, but I don't even
know where to... I mean...

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_010.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_010.text:
We found Hasumi's diary in the Kieru Ruins.
There was a lot of information in there
that came as news to Nana.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_020.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_020.text:
Is that so? I was unaware Hasumi
left any records behind... Yes, well, let me start from the beginning.
This is all from memory, mind, so it might differ
slightly from Hasumi's diary, but believe me
when I say I have no intention to deceive you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_030.text:
It's okay, Mom. I know you're
not that kind of person.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_040.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_040.text:
Nuy received the markings of the maiden when
she was younger than Nana is now. Everyone was
delighted to have a maiden from Berta Village,
and our family doubly so.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_050.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_050.text:
Soon, the Soyay arrived—that was Hasumi—
with a baby in her arms. The child was
far different than Imeru seedlings,
but adorable all the same.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_060.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_060.text:
None of us had ever heard of a Soyay with a baby,
including the clerics. Seeing them at a loss for
how to handle the situation, I offered to care
for the child—for you, Nana.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_070.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_070.text:
Nuy and Hasumi left soon thereafter
on the journey of trials, but along
the way, Hasumi...she perished.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_080.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_080.text:
Yet Nuy managed through to the end
and bloomed into a beautiful Epuyke—
one filled both with her own spirit
and the steadfast heart of Hasumi.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_090.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_090.text:
Hasumi left this for me before she departed,
and told me to give this to Nana should
anything happen. I should have done this
much sooner, but... Well, here it is.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_100.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_100.text:
Looks like a photo from her original world.
This baby must be Nana, and I'm guessing
the lady holding her is her mother, Hasumi. There are a number of other people visible
as well, but I have no idea how they relate
to the two of you—or even if they do.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_120.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_120.text:
Yeah, they all look really happy—
although that's usually what people
try to look like in pictures.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_130.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_130.text:
I raised you in Hasumi's stead.
It was difficult, since you are
not Imeru, but I could not bear
the thought of losing you. That's why I never showed you this
picture: because if you saw it and
chose to leave, I...I couldn't...

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_140.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_140.text: I know how hard you worked for me, Mom, and I'm truly, truly grateful. Without you, I would have been dead a long time ago. So no matter what I learn and no matter what I see, I will always be your little girl.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_150.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_150.text:
But I do have one question:
why did you dress me in my
birth-mother's clothes?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_160.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_160.text:
I thought the god of the Imeru might
have chosen you as the maiden so you could
return to your original world, and... Well, I suppose I just
wanted you to fit in.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_170.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_170.text:
I'm Imeru, Mom—I wouldn't have the faintest
IDEA what to do if I was thrown back into my
own world after all this time. I think the
god of the Imeru understands that.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_180.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_180.text:
So you're planning to continue
your journey as the maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_190.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_190.text:
Even though I'm very confused about what
the Imeru god wants from me, I'm going
to do what I am meant to do.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_200.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_BERUTA_310_CUT_000_200.text: I love you, Mom. Epuyke nogonoa kowo.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Welcome, Nana, maiden of the Epuyke.
And you as well, Soyays the Pollinators.
I am the witness for the Trial of Strength.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Do you understand the relationship
between Ancikar and the Epuyke, Maiden?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Sure do! The Epuyke transforms the evil god
Ancikar's dreams into blessings for the land,
keeping Ancikar asleep and protecting us all
from his wickedness.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
You speak true. Then tell me, do you
understand the relationship between
the Imeru and the Kikir?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
The Imeru provide the Maiden of
the Epuyke, while the Kikir fight
Ancikar's fiends. Some Imeru think the Kikir don't do anything,
but that's wrong. All of them put their lives
on the line every day for this world's
peace and prosperity.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
My mom's been teaching me about all of this
since I was young; she wanted to make sure
I understood this world better than anyone.
And I was interested in the Kikir anyway.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
I expect no less from Yuk. She comes from
a line of exceptional maidens, and raised you
to be a fine individual. This is doubtless why
you were chosen to be the maiden!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text:
I know many Imeru who have strong opinions on
your being a maiden, but we Kikir mind not the
differences between you and the maidens of the
past. We care only that you believe in yourself.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_0.text: And what's our role in all this?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_1.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_1.text:
Okay, that sounds doable.
Let's go find ourselves a fiend.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_1.speaker: Witness_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_300_CUT_000_1.text:
And now, Soyays the Pollinators,
guide well the Maiden of the Epuyke!
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_310_CUT_000_0.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_310_CUT_000_0.text: The trial will take place here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_310_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_310_CUT_000_0.text:
Know that many Soyay lives have
been forfeited in this very trial,
so do not let your guard down. I shall now summon the fiend...
O great god of the Kikir, bring us
a mighty fiend from a world beyond!
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_310_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_310_CUT_010_0.text:
Hear me, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke!
Hear me, Soyays the Pollinators! You have done very well in your trial,
and I pray you might become the Epuyke.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
You are Hasumi's daughter,
are you not?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text: So it seems. Is that a problem?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
Those of us who aid in the Epuyke's trials
do not record the names of either maidens
or Soyay, for to do so may lead to doubts
over the Imeru god's choices.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
However, no summoner of strength could
ever forget the names of Hasumi or Nuy,
because it is they who taught us the true
meaning of the trials.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
We believed the trial of strength was simply
a way to test the Soyay's physical prowess.
We thought there was only meaning in victory. Alas, our thinking was shallow;
the significance of the trial
runs far, far deeper.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text: Though Hasumi lost her life in the trial, her heart was bound to Nuy—and consequently, Nuy bloomed into a beautiful Epuyke. So you see, the true significance of this trial is to test the bond between the hearts of the maiden and her Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_000_0.text:
Hear me, Nana, Maiden of the Epuyke.
Hear me, Soyays the Pollinators.
I expect your hearts to find their
true bond through this trial.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
Well, we defeated it. Does this mean
our hearts are more connected now?
Because I don't feel any different.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
I'm not sure about that, but I DO know
I wanted you to win more than anything! Still, I'm sure Nuy was thinking the same
thing when she watched Hasumi fight,
and Hasumi ended up losing anyway.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
Feel awful? How could she feel AWFUL!?
She gave her own LIFE for Nuy—
what more could she do!? I mean, what are the people who get left
behind even supposed to DO with that?
Hell, maybe the only choice is to
risk my OWN life and—

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
It's okay, Nana. We're both still alive,
and we're going to guide you to the end.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.speaker: Summoner_of_Strength
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_STRENGTH_320_CUT_010_0.text:
I have just witnessed a miracle: Hasumi's heart
has crossed the boundaries of time to bond with
her daughter. I will now cherish and care for
this trial even more. Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Nana, maiden of the Epuyke!
Hail, Soyays the Pollinators!
I stand ready to bear witness
to the Trial of Love. Your task is thus: take these
vine seeds and plant them in the
holes upon the plateau.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_300_CUT_000_030.text:
Um... Aren't you going to ask
me the meaning of this trial?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Witness_of_Love
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_300_CUT_000_040.text:
What meaning the maiden assigns to
this trial is left to her discretion. What meaning is there in choosing the holes?
In spreading the seeds? In Ancikar's fiends?
In the very vines themselves? I would have you think on all these
things with a heart full of love.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_000_000.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_000_000.text:
This hole is ripe for some seeds.
Want to plant them here?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_010_000.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_010_000.text: That takes care of the seeds.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_010_010.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_010_010.text:
I've always tried to picture what
kind of seed I sprouted from. I mean, I figure it's different from most
other people's, so I always imagined it 
as being sort of transparent and shiny.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_010_020.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_010_020.text:
Hoo-boy. Okay, this is a touch awkward,
but you didn't come from a seed.
You came out of your mother's belly.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_010_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_010_030.text:
WHAAAT!? But if you sprouted from your
mom's belly, that means she DIED!
Nuh-uh, no way! Keep your creepy
world the hell away from me!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_010_040.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_010_040.text:
I admit it's a crazy way to be born,
but life is just strange that way.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_020_000.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_020_000.text:
Those were Ancikar's fiends. The sprout
should have plenty of nutrition, so we
just need to wait for it to do its thing.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_030_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_030_000.text:
So what meaning is there in the vines, huh?
I mean, I've been thinking with a loving heart
like I'm supposed to, but I can't see anything
but...you know. Vines. Is this what it's like to become
the Epuyke? It seems so superficial.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_030_010.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_030_010.text:
I don't think there's a right answer here.
The witness said you needed to assign
your own meaning to this trial, right?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_030_011.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_030_011.text:
I reckon you're just sayin' that 'cause
you ain't got the faintest idea what
this whole mess is supposed to me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_030_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_LOVE_310_CUT_030_020.text:
You're probably right, though: it's up to
the maiden to think about this herself.
Thank you, Soyays.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_000.text:
At last you have come, Nana,
Maiden of the Epuyke. This season's Epuyke blossomed full and
beautiful. It absorbed the dreams of the
evil god Ancikar who slumbers underground,
then brilliantly returned to the earth.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_020.text:
Aren't you nervous because
I'm not Imeru?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_030.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_030.text:
You have been chosen by the god of the Imeru.
To find unease in this fact would be to show
distrust and insult to our deity.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_040.speaker: Priestess of Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_040.text:
You were raised here. You are Imeru.
We expect great things from you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_300_CUT_000_050.text:
And I'm gonna do everything I can
to live up to those expectations!

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_300_CUT_000_010.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_300_CUT_000_010.text:
It didn't grow out of the ground
itself... There was a maiden...

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_320_CUT_000_030.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_320_CUT_000_030.text:
Are the Kikir the only ones
who eat pollen around here?

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_320_CUT_000_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_320_CUT_000_040.text:
Nope. Anyone who wants seeds also eats it.
But, uh, I'm not old enough for that yet.

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_020.speaker: Kikiris1
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_020.text:
Become the Epuyke!
Feed us tasty pollen!

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_030.text: Do you think I can do that?

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_040.speaker: Kikiris2
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_330_CUT_000_040.text:
Absolutely! I know you'll shower
us with tasty, tasty pollen.

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_340_CUT_000_020.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_POLLEN_340_CUT_000_020.text: I'm working on my trials now.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_050.text:
So I'm absolutely going to do my
best here, but I have one request: When I become the Epuyke, will you please
look after Mom? I want her to live the
rest of her life without worry.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_060.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_060.text:
Worry not, she will be treated very well.
Relatives of the Epuyke are valuable—and as
she raised you to be the Maiden of the Epuyke,
her experience is doubly so.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_070.text: Well, you're right about that: Mom is an exceptional Imeru.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_080.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_FLOWER_310_CUT_000_080.text:
We pray you will bloom into an
equally exceptional Epuyke.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Maiden Nana!
Hail, Soyays the Pollinators!
The time for the ritual has come.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_000_050.text:
I finally feel like I can do this, Soyays—
and if I DO manage to become the Epuyke,
it'll all be because of you. So...thanks.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_050.text:
If I manage to become the Epuyke, it's
all going to be because of my Soyays.
Thanks for everything you did for me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_060.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_060.text: And thanks to your moms, as well.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_070.text:
You're right. I feel like...
I can do this.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_110.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_110.text:
Nana really managed to become the
Epuyke. The sight of her there is just...
I'm not even sure what to say.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_120.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_310_CUT_000_120.text:
I questioned the Imeru god's choice at first,
just as I did when her mother was summoned as
the Soyay—but I see now all was done according
to our god's great plan. Praise be to mother and daughter!
Praise be to Soyays and Epuyke!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_000_050.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_000_050.text:
Do you think I'll be able to bloom
into the Epuyke? I mean, I haven't
actually done ANYTHING!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_000_060.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_000_060.text:
You were chosen by the god of the Imeru,
right? I'm sure you'll be fine.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_070.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_070.text:
It will not work. The ritual is a failure.
Ancikar refuses to accept a maiden
that is not Imeru!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_090.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_090.text:
I couldn't do it, Soyay! I'm useless!
My body is useless and I can't change it!
Why did the Imeru god even choose me!?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_100.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_100.text: I will graft in her place.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_110.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_110.text:
Return to your people, Nana.
This is the will of the Imeru god.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_120.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_120.text:
Indeed. Ancikar will most
certainly accept Yuk.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_140.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_000_140.text:
There's no time!
Come, Yuk! This way!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_000.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_000.text:
That animal body was quite convenient for
Ancikar, was it not? Indeed, Ancikar has never
before manifested in this manner!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_010.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_010.text:
Cram it! This is another trial given to us by the
god of the Imeru. Hasumi, Nana, us, AND the
triangle are all connected, and we're going
to give this a happy ending no matter what!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_011.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_011.text:
Ready when you are, hon—let's go make sure
everything Hasumi and Nana did and felt for
each other amounts to more than a hill'a beans!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_020.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_010_020.text:
Can you hear us, Nana? We need your help
as the Epuyke's maiden. Help us fight!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_000.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_000.text:
I'm so sorry, Nana! If we hadn't been caught up
with the triangles and Quisstatium, you never
would've been taken over by one of Ancikar's
fiends—OR been chosen as maiden to begin with!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_010.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_010.text:
Quiss Stamina's interference likely started back
when Hasumi was first called to this world—
reckon they was tryin' to influence Ancikar
in some way even then. But then the god of the Imeru tried to
block their goals by protectin' Nana
through Yuk, and then by callin' us.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_030.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_340_CUT_020_030.text:
Shucks, that ain't true.
She's right there.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_000.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_000.text:
Nana really is amazing. She wasn't born Imeru,
yet she managed to become the Epuyke anyway.
That has to be some kind of miracle.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_001.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_001.text:
Callin' it a miracle sorta ignores all the
hard work Nana put in to make it happen. We've both met plenty of physically strong
people on the battlefield, but real strength?
Gut strength? That's rare—and our girl Nana
has it in spades. SHE'S the miracle here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_020.text:
You have borne witness to the Imeru's
Epuyke festival as the 1,080,362nd
Soyays the Pollinators. I now pronounce
you freed from your duty.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_030.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_030.text:
Is it okay if we stay here until Nana...
Er, until the Epuyke blooms?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_050.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_050.text:
She's going to bloom beautifully, create pollen,
and bring happiness to both the Imeru and Kikir—
and I want to watch it all happen.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_060.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_060.text:
You are now merely two women, and we
cannot stand here speaking to you,
for we must be off to greet the 1,080,363rd
Soyay the Pollinator.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_070.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_070.text:
But we have one thing for you.
The Epuyke was clad in these.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_080.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_080.text:
These are Nana's clothes!
...No. Yuk should have these.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_100.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_010_100.text:
Epuyke nogonoa kowo to you,
the 1,080,362nd Soyays the Pollinators!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_020.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_020.text:
No. You will always be Nana's Soyays.
That's why I want you to take these.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_030.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_030.text:
This here's Nana's outfit!
Don't you wanna keep it?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_040.speaker: Yuku
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_040.text:
She chose to live her life as an Imeru,
but I believe she harbored a wish in
her heart to see other worlds. So please...
Take at least a part of her with you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_050.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_300_CUT_030_050.text:
All right then, Nana.
Let's go see some worlds.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_000.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_000.text:
I still don't know what the god of the Imeru
was trying to do here—I mean, we never even
found a clue about where the next triangle is!
This whole thing's left a bad taste in my mouth.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_010.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_010.text:
We hope to ask this of the god ourselves,
for never once have Soyays so irresponsible
ever been summoned to us. But enough of this—we must begin the
trials for the next maiden and Soyay.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_020.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_020.text:
You have borne witness to the Imeru's
Epuyke festival as the 1,080,362nd
Soyays the Pollinators, and I now
pronounce you freed from your duty. Now take this and go.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_030.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_030.text:
You had it the whole time!? Land sakes,
you really WERE determined to get under
our skin until the very end, huh?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_050.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_320_CUT_010_050.text:
Forget it, Bonnie. We got what we came for,
so let's just get out of here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_000.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_000.text:
I sure hope you're okay with this, Mom.
I mean, at least you'll have company,
since Nuy is in the Maiden's Garden. I know now that Nuy's my older sister,
and I really hope you both find peace.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_010.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_010.text:
I miss you, Mom, and I...
I don't know what I’m going
to do without you. *sniff*

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_020.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_020.text:
Tears ain't gonna bring Yuk back, darlin'.
Besides, how's your ma supposed to rest
easy on the other side seein' you like this.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_040.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_010_040.text:
We're with you, Nana. Let's stay and
watch your mom bloom together.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_020_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_020_040.text: What is it, Mom? Did you see Nuy?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_020_060.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_020_060.text:
She's gone to the Maiden's Garden...
I sure hope she's happy getting to
see Nuy again after all this time.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_010.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_010.text:
We're not Soyays any more; I'm just Formina,
and this is just Bonnie. So what are you planning to do now?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_011.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_011.text:
If you wanna come visit other worlds with us,
we'd be real happy to have you, darlin'.
It ain't gonna be easy, but I also promise
you ain't never gonna be bored.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_030.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_030.text: I'm an Imeru. My place is here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_040.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_040.text:
Mom wanted me to leave this world once
my trials were finished, and that's exactly
what I'm gonna do! Er, I mean, if that's
all right with the two of you?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_070.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_070.text:
Thanks, but I'm Imeru, and I need
to protect my mom's lineage. One day, I'll eat the Epuyke's pollen,
harbor a seed inside me, and raise a
maiden like Nuy. I just hope I can
do it all as good as Mom did.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_080.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_080.text:
If that's what you want,
we'll be rooting for you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_090.speaker: Nana
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_EPUIKE_330_CUT_030_090.text:
Oh, but I don't need these clothes anymore,
so you can have them. I'd like you to take them
to my birth mother's world if you ever get the
chance. But for now, Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_END_POLLEN_300_CUT_000.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_END_POLLEN_300_CUT_000.text:
This is Nana's pollen. I don't know if we'll
ever end up visiting the world she came from,
but why don't we take her along anyway?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TRIANGLE_330_CUT_000_0.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TRIANGLE_330_CUT_000_0.text:
You have toiled well, Soyays,
and we have a reward for you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TRIANGLE_330_CUT_000_0.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TRIANGLE_330_CUT_000_0.text: A triangle! So you DID have it!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TRIANGLE_330_CUT_000_0.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TRIANGLE_330_CUT_000_0.text:
You have borne witness to the Imeru's Epuyke
festival as the 1,080,362nd Soyays the Pollinators.
I now pronounce you freed from your duty.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TRIANGLE_330_CUT_000_0.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TRIANGLE_330_CUT_000_0.text:
Do you think this triangle had anything
to do with the Epuyke or Ancikar?

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TRIANGLE_330_CUT_000_0.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TRIANGLE_330_CUT_000_0.text:
Darlin', I got no earthly idea.
Either way, we've found it now,
so let's mosey on outta here.

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TRIANGLE_210_CUT_000_0.speaker: Priestess_of_Imeru R
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_TRIANGLE_210_CUT_000_0.text:
You have borne witness to the Imeru's Epuyke
festival as the 80,136th Soyays the Pollinators.
I now pronounce you freed from your duty.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_RETURN_999_CUT_000_000.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_EVAR_BOFO_RETURN_999_CUT_000_000.text:
I feel like we ought to take some
of the Epuyke's pollen with us.

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_TRIANGLE_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_TRIANGLE_100_CUT_000_0.text:
This is a fiend's egg! Does this have
something to do with the triangles?

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_TRIANGLE_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_TRIANGLE_100_CUT_000_0.text:
Reckon the fastest way to find out
is to just smash the darn thing.

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_TRIANGLE_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_TRIANGLE_100_CUT_000_0.text:
So is this thing an egg shell,
or did it come from an egg?

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_TRIANGLE_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_TRIANGLE_100_CUT_000_0.text:
I don't know, but it clearly has
something to do with Ancikar.

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_TRIANGLE_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_TRIANGLE_100_CUT_000_0.text:
Nah, that don't sit right with me.
I'm gonna choose to believe
Lela created it for us.

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_TRIANGLE_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Formina_Franklyn
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_TRIANGLE_100_CUT_000_0.text:
You know what, Bonnie? You're right.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo!

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_TRIANGLE_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_TRIANGLE_200_CUT_000_0.text:
Nah, that don't sit right with me.
I'm gonna choose to believe
Chup created it for us.

SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_TRIANGLE_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Bonnie_Blair
SUB_W11_GIMK_BOFO_TRIANGLE_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Nah, that don't sit right with me.
I'm gonna choose to believe
Nana created it for us.
